attributes.action: Stop Dartmoor Ponies being farmed for zoo meat
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800 dartmoor ponies are slaughtered for the zoo meat scheme each year.  Farmers who own them report that they can't get more than £1 at auction.  Finding one of these ponies for £1 seems impossible, they are worth more for meat.
If these beautiful ponies only have a fate of zoo meat then their breeding should be controlled.  None are truly wild, they are owned by farmers who make more money on a sale for zoo meat than elsewhere and turned out onto the moor for cheap upkeep.
Please sign my petition to stop these ponies being sold for zoo meat and put a proper and acceptable breeding programme in place.
